attributes.comment:
I'd like to comment on Docket ID: USCIS-2006-0044, Adjustment of the
Immigration Benefit Application/ Petition and Biometric Fee Schedule as it
pertains to the I-600/I-600A filing fees. These fees are collected from prospective
adoptive parents who are planning to adopt orphans internationally. The costs of
adoption are already very expensive and adding to those costs will result in fewer
orphans finding their forever families and instead aging out of their country's
orphanage system. The statistics of what happens to those children are very
grim. Due to the lengthy wait to complete adoptions, many parents must
reapply and pay the associated fees for their I-600/I-600A applications becuase
their I-171H has expired prior to the adoption being completed. If the cost to
process I-600/I-600A applications is more costly than the current fees, I would not
oppose the increase in fees, if and only if, the expiration dates for fingerprints and
I-171H are extended to reflect the amount of time it takes to complete nternational
adoptions.

Thank you for considering my comment.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by C. Waterman
